snippet: Rwanda and the Democratic Republic of Congo agreed to accept international help to take on rebels in eastern Congo, and the African Union said it was ready to send peacekeepers there.
abstract: Rwanda and the Democratic Republic of Congo agree to accept international help to take on rebels in eastern Congo, and the African Union says it is ready to send peacekeepers there; United Nations peacekeepers already operate in the region.
lead_paragraph: Rwanda and the Democratic Republic of Congo agreed to accept international help to take on rebels in eastern Congo, and the African Union said it was ready to send peacekeepers there.

headline.seo: Rwanda and Congo Reach Deal on International Forces
headline.main: 2 Africa Leaders Reach an Accord on Foreign Force
headline.print_headline: 2 Africa Leaders Reach an Accord On Foreign Force
